body_html: Each map invocation itself does not have a thread pool, instead it schedules the invocations using the interop_thread_pool (which has a default size of cpu_core_count). Try increasing the size of the interop_thread_pool to 20 and see what effect it has on the runtime.
body_text: Each map invocation itself does not have a thread pool, instead it schedules the invocations using the interop_thread_pool (which has a default size of cpu_core_count). Try increasing the size of the interop_thread_pool to 20 and see what effect it has on the runtime.
body: Each `map` invocation itself does not have a thread pool, instead it schedules the invocations using the `interop_thread_pool` (which has a default size of `cpu_core_count`). Try increasing the size of the `interop_thread_pool` to `20` and see what effect it has on the runtime.
